doc.field: TO PURCHASE TREASURY BILLS FOR A CUSTOMER

- The Federal Reserve will purchase approximately one billion dlrs of U.S. Treasury bills for a customer after the Treasury's auction of four-year notes, a Fed spokesman said. The spokesman said the Fed intends to purchase bills maturing in up to six months. Dealers said Federal funds were trading at 6-3/16 pct when the Fed announced the operation. Many had expected to Fed to buy bills for itself, thereby adding permanent reserves to the banking system. Since it did not do so today, this Fed move is likely tomorrow.
